poem:
Title: To the Swift-Footed Painter

Stirring the silent canvas,
Barrangi, swift-footed like Mercury,
Blurs the boundaries - of being and doing.
Quickened by life's elusive stencil,
Painting reality's race in ochre and cobalt.
Leeds now becomes his arena, his masterpiece,
Where muscle and pigment weave tales
Of migration, of disability, of resilience. 
Unseen wings now push the brush,
Where once they propelled the limb,
In the race of a different kind.
